issues.name: Headings; Wrong Order, Empty & Missing Headings;

issues.title: Heading levels should only increase by one
issues.description: Ensure the order of headings is semantically correct

any.message: Heading order invalid

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  Heading order invalid

issues.title: Page should contain a level-one heading
issues.description: Ensure that the page, or at least one of its frames contains a level-one heading

all.message: Page must have a level-one heading

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix all of the following:
  Page must have a level-one heading

issues.title: Heading elements are not in a sequentially-descending order
issues.description: Properly ordered headings that do not skip levels convey the semantic structure of the page, making it easier to navigate and understand when using assistive technologies. [Learn more about heading order](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/heading-order).

node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Heading order invalid

issues.title: <html> element must have a lang attribute
issues.description: Ensure every HTML document has a lang attribute

any.message: The <html> element does not have a lang attribute

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  The <html> element does not have a lang attribute

issues.title: The html element should have a lang or xml:lang attribute which describes the language of the document.
issues.description:
<html><head>
    <meta charset="utf-8...</html>

original_issue.message: The html element should have a lang or xml:lang attribute which describes the language of the document.

issues.title: `<html>` element does not have a `[lang]` attribute
issues.description: If a page doesn't specify a `lang` attribute, a screen reader assumes that the page is in the default language that the user chose when setting up the screen reader. If the page isn't actually in the default language, then the screen reader might not announce the page's text correctly. [Learn more about the `lang` attribute](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/html-has-lang).

node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  The <html> element does not have a lang attribute

issues.title: Images must have alternative text
issues.description: Ensure elements have alternative text or a role of none or presentation

any.message: Element does not have an alt attribute
aria-label attribute does not exist or is empty
aria-labelledby attribute does not exist, references elements that do not exist or references elements that are empty
Element has no title attribute
Element's default semantics were not overridden with role="none" or role="presentation"

issues.title: Image elements do not have `[alt]` attributes
issues.description: Informative elements should aim for short, descriptive alternate text. Decorative elements can be ignored with an empty alt attribute. [Learn more about the `alt` attribute](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/image-alt).

aria-label attribute does not exist or is empty

Element has no title attribute
Element has no placeholder attribute

issues.title: This textinput element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: label element, title undefined, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.
issues.description: <input class="et-search-field">

original_issue.message: This textinput element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: label element, title undefined, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.

issues.title: This form field should be labelled in some way. Use the label element (either with a "for" attribute or wrapped around the form field), or "title", "aria-label" or "aria-labelledby" attributes as appropriate.
issues.description: <input class="et-search-field">

original_issue.message: This form field should be labelled in some way. Use the label element (either with a "for" attribute or wrapped around the form field), or "title", "aria-label" or "aria-labelledby" attributes as appropriate.

issues.title: Form elements do not have associated labels
issues.description: Labels ensure that form controls are announced properly by assistive technologies, like screen readers. [Learn more about form element labels](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/label).

issues.title: Links do not have a discernible name
issues.description: Link text (and alternate text for images, when used as links) that is discernible, unique, and focusable improves the navigation experience for screen reader users. [Learn how to make links accessible](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/link-name).

issues.title: This form does not contain a submit button, which creates issues for those who cannot submit the form using the keyboard. Submit buttons are INPUT elements with type attribute "submit" or "image", or BUTTON elements with type "submit" or omitted/invalid.
issues.description:
<form class="et-search-form">
              <input class="et...</form>

original_issue.message: This form does not contain a submit button, which creates issues for those who cannot submit the form using the keyboard. Submit buttons are INPUT elements with type attribute "submit" or "image", or BUTTON elements with type "submit" or omitted/invalid.
